basics.name: Ozan Akyıldız
basics.label: Robotics Engineer
basics.summary: Robotics engineer with a strong background in ADAS and AI, combining technical expertise in perception, sensor fusion, and embedded AI with hands-on experience in vehicle integration and testing. Proficient in ROS2, C++, Python, and multi-arch containerized workflows. Skilled at designing systems that connect development, deployment, and validation in real-world automotive environments.

work.summary: Worked on ADAS perception, radar integration, and end-to-end system infrastructure for multi-sensor test vehicles.
highlights: Built ROS2-based perception pipelines on TI TDA4VH/J784S4 with ONNX Runtime + TIDL EP.
Designed an extensible radar interface architecture to unify multi-vendor radars over CAN/FD using FastDDS.
Implemented ADAS functions: traffic sign recognition, high-beam assist pipelines, detection stabilization, BEV projections.
Integrated sensors (cameras, Ouster LiDAR, OxTS INS/GNSS) with calibration, PTP sync, and logging workflows.
Developed CI/CD pipelines and containerized multi-arch images for deployment on test vehicles.

work.summary: Led development of autonomous drive-by-wire EV kit with ROS.
highlights: Designed and implemented autonomous drive-by-wire EV kit with ROS on Jetson NX and Arduino CAN controllers.
Developed firmware, ROS middleware, teleop/camera nodes, and basic autonomy modules.
Produced wiring harnesses, power circuitry, and prototype hardware enclosures.
Supervised control, perception, and mechanical engineers while creating system documentation.

work.summary: Developed robotic radiation scanning platform with automated data collection.
highlights: Converted radiation cart into a robotic platform with live LIDAR-SLAM, dynamic URDF, and diagnostics.
Automated radiation data collection with 3D visualization and ROS pipelines.
Designed custom sensor circuits and implemented I2C drivers for embedded controllers.

work.summary: Supported research on teleoperated nursing robot perception and motion.
highlights: Supervised teams and deployed robotic systems using ROS controllers.
Reduced user study training time from 9 hours to 2 with improved study design.
Enhanced ROSJava camera libraries and created mobile monitoring apps.

work.summary: Improved and migrated distributed system smart contracts.
highlights: Improved the main smart contract and supported migration of the system for stability and scalability.

work.summary: Designed a decentralized system concept for a creative collective.
highlights: Designed system architecture for a creative collective (exploratory project, not realized).
